events.title: Captain James Cook discovers the eastern coast of Australia
events.description: On April 29, 1770, Captain James Cook aboard the HMS Endeavour made contact with the eastern coast of Australia, specifically the area now known as Botany Bay, paving the way for British colonization.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of European settlement in Australia, profoundly altering the continent's history and indigenous cultures.

events.title: German surrender in World War II in Italy
events.description: On April 29, 1945, German forces in Italy surrendered to the Allies, marking the collapse of Nazi resistance in that theater near the end of World War II in Europe.
events.significance: The surrender accelerated the end of World War II in Europe and contributed to the eventual Allied victory.

events.title: The Partition Plan for Palestine is adopted by the UN
events.description: On April 29, 1947, the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine released its report recommending the partition of Palestine into separate Jewish and Arab states.
events.significance: This plan led to the establishment of the state of Israel and has had lasting geopolitical ramifications in the Middle East.

events.title: Los Angeles Riots begin
events.description: On April 29, 1992, the Los Angeles riots erupted following the acquittal of four police officers charged with assaulting Rodney King, an African American motorist, igniting widespread civil unrest.
events.significance: The riots exposed racial tensions and police brutality issues in the United States, leading to national dialogue and reforms.

events.title: Royal Wedding of Prince William and Catherine Middleton
events.description: On April 29, 2011, Prince William married Catherine Middleton in Westminster Abbey, an event broadcast worldwide and watched by millions.
events.significance: The wedding symbolized modernizing traditions of the British monarchy and generated significant cultural interest globally.
